Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! Mitsuketa!
When did we get this friendly, Nenohi?
Hm? Dou iu imi?
Well, you've dropped the formal variants for almost all of your spoken phrases.
Hontouda! You're right, Kanchou! I didn't even notice! Does it bother you?
It doesn't bother me. As long as my seniority isn't being overlooked.
Never, Kanchou! It just feels strange speaking with you the same way I'd speak to a stranger.

Fields.MenuText: Is it difficult to remember when to use formal and casual language?

Fields.DialogueText: You'd think so, but embodying the culture does away with most of the struggle.

Fields.MenuText: Do you use formal language when talking to other Belles?

Fields.DialogueText: It depends. Those in my family don't require such formality, but it's common courtesy when trying to make a good impression with a stranger. I'll speak politely... until they give me a reason not to!

Fields.MenuText: Am I free to do the same?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, Kanchou, in all fairness, you have been using my first name all this time without batting an eye! Now I'm used to it, but it was a little embarrassing at first. Hatsuharu is my class name.
*ALARM*
Aramu da! Yosh, ikuzou!
We really have devolved into a couple of school children, haven't we? I suppose as long as the Morganas are taken care of it's fine. I'm right behind you!
@BATTLE
Kanchou! I'm going on ahead! Ittekuru!
Nenohi, wait! There's no getting through to that girl...
@BATTLE
Wah! Tsukareta~ Thank you for your support, Kanchou.
Nenohi... By the time we arrived, the entire Morgana fleet had already been sunk!
Eh? Monku aru no? Surely that's a good thing.
It is until you find yourself staring down an enemy you can't defeat. The crew and I are here to help. You don't need to do everything yourself.
*Sigh* Tasshikani. Sometimes I can't help myself! I'd rather run on ahead than hang back and be a burden.

Fields.MenuText: We gave you that radio transmitter for a reason.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai... I've been shirking my language studies as of late and that has put me off talking with the rest of the fleet.

Fields.MenuText: What would I do if something happened to you?

Fields.DialogueText: Hazukashii...

Fields.MenuText: Have you always been this way?

Fields.DialogueText: As long as I can remember. Japanese culture is focused a lot more on community rather than the individual. If I can do something to help others, then I'm happy to do so!
Could you do me a favor? Don't die doing something reckless before this war ends. Could you do that for me?
Shouganai ne~ It's a direct order from my Kanchou, after all!
That sure is a lot of books you have there, Nenohi. Any particular reason you're cramming so hard?
Ah! Kanchou! I mentioned that I've been struggling as of late to find the motivation to continue my language studies.
Yes, I remember it in passing.
As the war drags on, I can't help but feel more and more jaded as to the pointlessness of it all. My government in particular has no qualms sending young men to a watery grave.
Well, I can't speak for the Japanese government, but I know a thing or two about mutually assured destruction.
Ne? However, I'm not one to let the weight of the world get me down! So, I thought I'd go back to basics!
Let me take a look at... Japanese 101?
Having grown up speaking the language, I never noticed all the interesting intricacies of my native tongue!
I think rekindling that spark with my homeland will inspire me to continue my studies in the future.

Fields.MenuText: So you're relearning your mother tongue?

Fields.DialogueText: Less relearning and more appreciating!

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps I could join you sometime? My kanji knowledge could use a little work.

Fields.DialogueText: Mochiron! I'll always be happy to lend a hand.

Fields.MenuText: Is Japanese really so interesting?

Fields.DialogueText: The base language and set expressions are fairly simple to remember, but there is so much depth and meaning behind some of these words it's astounding!
Well, I wish you luck reigniting that faint spark.
Hai, Kanchou! Makasete!
Aaaand fifty!
Adding to your stamp collection, Nenohi?
Ah! Kanchou, bikkurishita. Not exactly. I've been collecting stamps for a long time, so I thought about expanding my horizons.
I see. So, what is this new collection you've started?
Postcards!

Fields.MenuText: Postcards, huh?
They're quite similar to stamps, don't you think?

Fields.DialogueText: Nande sono kao... Do you have something against postcards, Kanchou?
That's partly the reason I chose them as my new hobby. Stamps can only tell me so much about other places, but postcards come equipped with beautiful pictures!

Fields.MenuText: Mind if I have a look at your collection?

Fields.DialogueText: Un! Onegai, I'd love to show you what I have so far!
*ALARM*
Morganas! Sorry, Nenohi, the art appreciation will have to wait!
Hai, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
De wa. Kanchou, which postcard would you like to view first? Just choose the picture! It will help you forge an unbiased opinion.

Fields.MenuText: The autumn leaves.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah! Kouyou da! This one is ripped straight from Japanese fall. Everyone raves about Japan's springtime sakura but, as you can see, the colder months are just as beautiful. This is from Hakone!

Fields.MenuText: The large skyscraper.

Fields.DialogueText: Eh!? Kanchou, it's been nearly ten years and you can't tell the Empire State Building apart from any other everyday structure. Mattaku...

Fields.MenuText: The torrential downpour.

Fields.DialogueText: This is from London, Kanchou. Hen da ne? People from England seem to pride themselves on their terrible weather enough to place it onto a postcard.
These are great, Nenohi. How did you acquire so many?
Truth be told, I've been asking the crews we encounter for souvenirs from their homeland. You see that one? "To Ken, love from Cecilia"?
Luckily, wartime divorce is growing by the day or I may never have been given it!
I see.
You know, Kanchou. We've been struggling a lot lately to keep things running smoothly. Have you ever thought about expanding our ranks?
I think we're doing fine as is. And if not, we just need to work harder.
You see right through me, Kanchou! Oh well, I suppose we'll sail around the entire world eventually.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Wherever they came from, I'm sure no one has collected a postcard from that place yet! Kanchou, with me!
@BATTLE
Kimochii ne~ Isn't it nice to stretch your legs in the warm sun, Kanchou?
It's certainly better than sitting behind a desk all day.
Or facing down a wave of Morganas.
*ALARM*
Uso desho?! Not two steps off the ship and we're already ambushed! It's like they have supersonic hearing!
@BATTLE
I really wish you wouldn't tempt fate so much, Nenohi.
I didn't know you were so superstitious, Kanchou.
I'm a sailor! My whole career is built on superstition!
Tasshikani! Still, I think it's important to not become so bogged down in worry. I made a mistake and now I know to keep my mouth shut.
At least until I'm halfway through my walk. I'm not satisfied at all yet!

Fields.MenuText: Is Japan very superstitious?

Fields.DialogueText: Japan is no stranger to superstitions. We often omit the numbers "shi" and "kyu" from hospital floors or rooms due to their connotations with death and pain.

Fields.MenuText: That's all well and good until you decide to test how hot a burning fire is.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha ha... Obviously, some mistakes can be avoided through common sense. Other times, it's better to make the mistake and learn from it than to live in constant paranoia.

Fields.MenuText: What's the worst mistake you've ever made?

Fields.DialogueText: After a transmission, I forgot to turn off my radio and said some... hurtful things to the incompetent man on the other end!
I learned that, sometimes, it's better that people know how you feel! I received an upgrade the very next day!
Well then. Here's to making more mistakes in the future!
I don't have a drink to hand, but Kanpai! I think I see another fleet of Morganas approaching! Care to join me in making another mistake, Kanchou?
I wouldn't have it any other way.
Kanchou? Something on your mind? You seem to be lost in thought out here.
I received a transmission and it seems we'll be entering treacherous waters soon. We all need to be prepared.
Souka... Will we be alone at that time?
We'll have some support, but they'll be separated. I'll be relying on your radio communications to keep things running smoothly.
Souka...
I'm serious, Nenohi. I know you like to sprint to the front of the pack but, this time, we really need you to hang back and coordinate the others. You're the only one who can do it.
Wakarimashita, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: Hey, you dipped back into formal Japanese.

Fields.DialogueText: You sounded awfully serious, Kanchou. I thought it fit the situation.

Fields.MenuText: Do you have any questions?
Any complaints?

Fields.DialogueText: Iie. Ganbarimasu!
A few but I'll hold off until the time comes.
*ALARM*
How about a quick warm-up for the battle ahead?
You won't scold me for going on ahead this time, will you? Here I go!
@BATTLE
*KABOOM*
All men to your positions!
There's no end to them, Kanchou!
Don't give up hope just yet! Keep pushing!
@BATTLE
We barely made it out of that unscathed.
The battle is not over yet, Kanchou. I fear it's only just begun.
How go the other fleets?
I'm staying in contact and offering advice when necessary. But...
But?
I can't stop twitching! Kanchou! This fight would be over should you give me permission to annihilate the enemy myself.

Fields.MenuText: I can't let you do that.
You still don't understand.

Fields.DialogueText: But Kanchou--!
Forgive me, I really don't.

Fields.MenuText: Are you questioning my orders?

Fields.DialogueText: Never, Kanchou. It's just...
Remember when I said it would be dreadful should you lose your life fighting an opponent stronger than you?
Hai, but let me reiterate. I am firmly resolved to lay down my life for a cause I believe in.
So what happens to the crew should you perish? You took out every fleet we ever encountered, right? The crew never had to lift a finger, right?
Kanchou...
The war doesn't end just because your life does! We'll keep fighting and we need to be prepared!
I'll be in the bridge. Someone has to prepare the crew for the second round of attacks.
To your business then, sailor.
Hai!
Oh, Nenohi?
Hai?
This is just one mistake. Don't feel discouraged. You'll learn from it, right?
Atarimae!
Everyone fall back, we'll try and flank them!
How is it looking?
Roger that!
We look to be through the worst of it.
Everyone's replying to your transmissions?
For now.
How about you, Nenohi? Are you feeling all right? I didn't mean to be so harsh back--
Hey! What are you guys doing? Don't you know better than to run on ahead without your team!? Kanchou, please - I'm a little busy at the moment.
Ha! Well, excuse me then. I'll take my leave.
Arigatou.
Oh, one last thing...
Hai?

Fields.MenuText: Give them hell!

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! Watashi ni makasete, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: I'm proud of you.

Fields.DialogueText: N-Nani itta no?! H...Hazukashii...

Fields.MenuText: Let those Morganas know this is one mistake they SHOULDN'T have made.

Fields.DialogueText: Iiyo! This is a regret they'll have to live with for the rest of their... well... soon-to-be-shortened lives!
Here they come again! Everyone get ready!
@BATTLE
Wah! Tsukareta~ Shinu~
Don't die on me yet, Nenohi! There's still some stragglers trying to escape. One last spurt!
@BATTLE
*SLAM*
Otsukaresamadeshita, Nenohi!
Arigatou gozaimasu... Kanchou mo, otsukare...

Fields.MenuText: What say we lift your head off the table now?

Fields.DialogueText: Just five more minutes...

Fields.MenuText: Are you going to be okay?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be fine. I'm just going to take a quick stroll into that bright light on the horizon. I shouldn't be too long...

Fields.MenuText: What's your verdict on a supportive backline role?

Fields.DialogueText: I expended less sweat fighting the Morganas face-to-face...
You did very well.
My throat feels like it's going to burst, but I'm glad everyone is safe.
It's all thanks to you. I've actually prepared a present for you. Here.
What is this?
A Superheterodyne Radio Receiver.
Arigatou, Kanchou, but I think if I look at another radio I'm going to be ill...
Nenohi... it's portable and a lot smaller than your typical Type 94-6.
You mean...?
Perhaps I was a little hasty. We have a destroyer at our fingertips and we've relegated her to a receptionist! We can affix the radio to your waist and you can fight and give orders at the same time.
*BOOF*
Nenohi!? What's with the impromptu hug? I thought you could barely stand.
Gomenne, Kanchou. Gaman dekinakatta...
That last scuffle really did a number on my hull.
And we've expended most of our weaponry as well.
Seeing as I have this fancy new portable radio, how about we take it for a test run?
Meaning?
I received word several days ago that we were scheduled for an upgrade.
Huh... Is that so...?
The only catch is, the seller asked to use your name in conversation when making future sales. Having someone of your rank as a valued customer will help with his business.

Fields.MenuText: Very well. I'll allow it this once.
I can't risk my reputation on some unknown merchant. If someone is injured through one of his products, it's on my head.

Fields.DialogueText: Phew! It's a good thing you said that, Kanchou. I already put the order in last week and the new bomber has been fitted this morning!
Understood, Kanchou! I'll let them know we aren't interested.
*ALARM*
New weapons or not, I'm ready to get back onto the field and show these Morganas what I'm capable of! Kanchou, ittekimasu~
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: It's a war, not a sporting event.

Fields.DialogueText: True, Kanchou. It did seem in poor taste.
*Sigh*
Something got you down, Nenohi? I see you've traded out your trusty textbook for what looks to be a letter.
As observant as ever, Kanchou...
What's got you looking so glum? I can only imagine the level of natural disaster required to wipe a smile off YOUR face.
It's not a personalized letter. Normally, I'd be overjoyed to receive a message from family or friends. It's just an update from back home.
What does it say?
I couldn't bring myself to finish the entire thing. Japan plans on sending even more young men to a watery grave. I can't bear to look at it.

Fields.MenuText: Do you consider yourself patriotic?

Fields.DialogueText: Under normal circumstances, very much so! I love Japan and everything that it encompasses. However, the war-obsessed officials in charge at present... them I could do without.

Fields.MenuText: Will you respond?

Fields.DialogueText: I've informed them of my operations but, as you already know, my first priority will always be this ship, the crew on board, and... well, the rest goes without saying!

Fields.MenuText: Will you be all right?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be fine, Kanchou! You know me - it'll take more than a disintegrating trust in my government to keep me down!
*ALARM*
Morganas! Time to put your money where your mouth is, Nenohi! The crew need your assistance!
Kakugoshite, Kanchou! I'm about to show you why I'm a destroyer!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, do you have a moment?
Of course, Nenohi. Take a seat. What's on your mind?
It's a little embarrassing...
I'm all ears. Let me close the door so that no one--
*ALARM*
Disturbs us...
Now who's tempting fate, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Right then. What did you want to talk about?
It's about the portable radio you gifted me, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Is it broken?
Do you not like it?

Fields.DialogueText: No, it's working perfectly! Better than perfect, even!
No, Kanchou! Hontouni daisuki! Demo...

Fields.MenuText: Do you need help with something?

Fields.DialogueText: No, it's all fairly self-explanatory.
Then what's the issue?
It's a little... heavy.
Heavy?
As a destroyer, I'm already loaded with so much gear at any one time. I find it difficult to balance at the best of times, but this radio appears to be the Morgana that broke the Belle's back!
I see. That is a problem.
Hai. I don't want to stop wearing it; battles become so much easier with it by my side. I was wondering if you had any tips on how to improve balance.
Ha! I've walked enough planks in my time as a hazed new recruit! Come with me. I'll fix you up right away!
Hontou!? Arigatou!
Why did we need to be off the ship for this exercise?
We're on the ship all day, every day. It's important to master balance on unfamiliar ground! We never know where a Morgana might strike, so you should be able to function on any given terrain.
Soudesune... Jya, yoroshiku onegaishimasu!
Here, take these textbooks and place them onto your head.
Like this?
Good. Now, remove your hand and do a full lap around the dock without dropping any in the water.
Muri da yo! I'll definitely drop some of these books into the water!
A little extra incentive for you to try harder! Plus, your quarters are getting a little cluttered, so I thought it was time for a clean-up anyway. Any books that survive you can bring back on board.
Kanchou~ Hido sugi~

Fields.MenuText: That's it, you're doing great!
Is all your gear necessary? Could you not drop something on either side to make room for the portable radio?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't...! Distract me...! Kanchou...!
Everything I wear is essential, Kanchou! The right side is dedicated to my crew and holds things like a first aid kit, while the left side is dedicated to my weaponry!
Don't you have mounted rifles on both your left and right sides?
I was talking about my katana, Kanchou. I'm a destroyer! Of course I have guns everywhere!

Fields.MenuText: Have you honestly read all these books?

Fields.DialogueText: Most of them but that's what a lifetime is for, right? I'll get to them eventually.
Nearly there...!
I did it!
Excellent balance, Nenohi! Here, let's get those books off your--
*ALARM*
KYA!
*SPLOOSH*
Eh!? Bikkurishita... Kanchou...!
No time to debate whose fault this is, Nenohi. How about we put your balancing act into practice? Here, I even shined your new radio for you!
@BATTLE
Hi Nenohi...
Hmph!
Come on, don't be like that. I apologized, didn't I?
You were only trying to help, I suppose. And, since our training, my balance has improved significantly. I barely even feel the radio anymore while moving.
Is this the only book to survive the... incident?
Yes, although I can barely get through the first chapter! This was going to be my crowning achievement after studying up on the other easier texts.
"Gone with the Wind." Never heard of it.
It's a touching love story apparently but with an interesting twist at the end.

Fields.MenuText: Are you an avid reader?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, yes, Kanchou! Japanese literature is wonderfully vivid and the writers are masters of wordplay.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't peg you as the romantic type, Nenohi.

Fields.DialogueText: Hidoi yo! Just because I love to build platonic relationships with friends doesn't mean I'm not romantic.

Fields.MenuText: Do you know the twist?

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, I didn't know you were that kind of person! Skipping to the end means missing out on the best part! The journey!
Still, it will take a lot for me to forgive you entirely.
Perhaps we could read it together sometime?
I'm not quite there yet, Kanchou. I need time to forgive your wrongdoing. Now, if you'll excuse me...
Nenohi! Nenohi, wait! If you leave where will I go? What will I do?
Frankly, Kanchou... I don't give a--
*ALARM*
Maybe a quick bout with some Morganas will soften that thick skin of yours.
Very well. Kanchou, please lend me your assistance!
@BATTLE
Kanchou! I've just received word that Morganas will soon be in the area!
I think I've already spotted a couple. What say we take out the scouting party first?
@BATTLE
This radio really comes in handy. I feel motivated all over again.

Fields.MenuText: What languages are you interested in studying?
That quickly?
Do you think you could fight Morganas while coordinating an entire fleet?

Fields.DialogueText: Why limit myself? If I go to the grave speaking every language out there, I'll be satisfied. I can make so many more friends in the afterlife that way!
You'd be surprised what a little good cheer can do for a lack of motivation!
It may take a while to get to that level, but here's hoping!
More Morganas are inbound, Nenohi!
This looks to be a large battle. I'll call in for backup. Hopefully I can coordinate everyone while fighting alongside them!
*BZZZ* Fall back and find a new vantage point! *BZZZ* Quickly, move in! *BZZZ* That's it, you did it! *BZZZ*
She's a natural. I'm tuned into the same frequency and I can barely keep up with what's happening.
*BZZZ* Kanchou! You've stopped moving. Is everything all right?
Oops... *BZZZ* Everything's fine, Nenohi. We're pulling up towards you now.
Ryoukai! There's some Morganas in the vicinity. Please handle them before we reconvene.
Ha! Aye-aye!
@BATTLE
Kanchou~! That looks to be the last of them. How was it? My debut as a radio-communicating, tactically organizing front-line destroyer!

Fields.MenuText: I've never been more impressed!

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatou, Kanchou! It means a lot to hear you say that.

Fields.MenuText: That language study really paid off, huh?

Fields.DialogueText: Thankfully, most sailors that cannot speak Japanese can speak English, which helps a little. It saves on learning a multitude of languages at once. At least for now.

Fields.MenuText: How was the balance?

Fields.DialogueText: I caught myself veering every now and again... but for the most part, I barely noticed anything!
*BZZRTTTT* *POOF*
Yabai! Kowarechatta!
Oh, no! It's okay. I have some tools in my quarters. We should be able to repair it fairly easily. Come to my quarters sometime and we can take a look at it.
Dou?
It's looking fixable. It may take me a short while but I can get it done.
Yatta!
You've never had to fix something like this before?
The closest I've ever come to something like this was trying to find a matching pair of shoes to go with an outfit...
Haha! Did you find them?
Mochiron, Kanchou! Who are you talking to!? I've always loved color - on clothing, stamps, now postcards...

Fields.MenuText: What spawned such a love?
Is Japan very colorful?
What's your favorite color?

Fields.DialogueText: How old are we, Kanchou? Did a military official just ask a destroyer warship what her favorite color is? As if we were infants?
Although if you must know... it's pink...
All year round! From vibrant popping colors in spring and summer to subdued and subtle colors in autumn and winter, everywhere is brimming with life!
Japan has always been interested in color, be it the design of a kimono or the delicate arranging of flowers.
*ALARM*
And... finished! Just in time! Let's take it for a test run!
Hai!
@BATTLE
The radio appears to be fully operational.
Indeed it does.
I was talking with some of the crews and they wanted to thank us for our efforts with some new equipment.
Is that so?
I told them we didn't fight for rewards, but they were very insistent. So I said I'd confer with you before making any decisions. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: I see no reason why we can't accept a gift from our companions.
You were right to refuse them. Accepting such a gift would set a precedent. We fight for justice, not for rewards.

Fields.DialogueText: Excellent! I'll be sure to get that new weaponry installed as soon as possible!
I thought as much. I just wanted to get your opinion first.
Kanchou! Mite, mite!
What is it?
Some kind of street vendor. I wonder if they're selling any stamps or postcards I could add to my collection. Can we have a look?
Sure, we have time. So long as we deal with these circling Morganas first. If we leave them be, there could be trouble.
Hai!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: They need that gun more than we do. That's what the IJN is for.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose it would be like letting a much less wealthy friend buy you dinner.
Konnichiwa!
Hello there, my dear. Step right up, everything you see can be yours for a price.
You don't happen to have any stamps or postcards, do you?
Hm? Let me take a look. One moment.

Fields.MenuText: Are you looking for anything in particular?

Fields.DialogueText: I mentioned before that I'm missing any souvenirs from Africa, but I'm always willing to pick up something with a cute design!

Fields.MenuText: Is collecting these souvenirs enough? Wouldn't you rather visit the places instead?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, someday, I'd love to sail around the world checking off countries I've collected souvenirs from. However, until that day comes, I'm perfectly comfortable admiring from afar.

Fields.MenuText: Which country has the best designed souvenirs, in your opinion?

Fields.DialogueText: I couldn't possibly pick. That would be like asking me to choose my favorite child!
*ALARM*
I can hear the alarm from here! There must be loads of them! Kanchou, you stay here and protect the townspeople. Leave the Morganas to me!
@BATTLE
That was quite the display. Are you all right, Miss?
Please, don't worry about me! As long as you're okay, that's all that matters!
Well, I managed to pull out some old stamps and postcards I've acquired over the years. I'd feel delighted if you would take one of each free of charge.
Oh, no, I couldn't possibly--
Please, it's the least I can do for someone who saved my life.
Arigatou gozaimashita! Kanchou, which one should I take?

Fields.MenuText: The field of flowers?

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? I already have so many floral print items...

Fields.MenuText: The large battleship?

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, you really are a workaholic!

Fields.MenuText: The mountain range?

Fields.DialogueText: The orange glow from the sunset is nice, but it feels like something is missing...
*ALARM*
Again!? I knew this was a bad place to set up shop!
Don't worry, please just protect your wares and we'll do the rest! Kanchou!
@BATTLE
That looks to be the last of them. Now I can finally... what's this?
This one caught your eye, Miss? I forgot I even owned it, to be honest.
It's beautiful. Such a large waterfall over a basin of water. Surrounded by such vibrant trees. Where's it from?
No idea. There's no indication on that postcard at all. Just the picture. If you like it, feel free to take it.
I think I will. Arigatou.
Oh, and if you ever find out where it's from, be sure to come back here and let me know!
*GASP* Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: You've got that look in your eye that spells trouble.
I think I already know what you're about to say.
Don't tell me...

Fields.DialogueText: We should search for this mystery paradise while on our travels!
I thought this might happen. We don't even have a clue of the continent it's from!
That will be part of the adventure!
Very well. I suppose I can keep my eyes peeled from the bridge for any mirage-like islands.
Yatta!
*ALARM*
Mata!? Let's teach these Morganas not to invade this port ever again!
@BATTLE
Thank you very much for your service. We'll be on our way now.
Wait, wait, wait! Your ship looks to have been severely damaged during those fights. The least I can do is provide you with some new weaponry.
Another gift?
I'm afraid this one will run you a little more than a piece of paper. I have to make a living somehow, right? What do you say?

Fields.MenuText: When in Rome.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah! Maybe the postcard is from Rome, Kanchou! Quickly - make the purchase, get back on the ship and let's set sail for Italy!

Fields.MenuText: I think we've given you enough business for one day.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you anyway!
*ALARM*
Perfect! Maybe I can squeeze some information about this postcard's location from these Morganas!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: We'll let dry dock be the judge of our condition.

Fields.DialogueText: Too true, too true. Far be it from me to upstage the experts.
Kanchou~!
You look in high spirits, Nenohi.
I've been asking everyone I bump into both on the ship and over the radio if they have ever seen a place like that shown on my postcard.
Is your giddiness a sign that you've found out?
Hantai da! No one has any clue whatsoever!
And why exactly is that making you beam like the Cheshire cat?
Isn't it obvious!? It makes the adventure that much more compelling to embark on!

Fields.MenuText: You really are a glutton for punishment!

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn't phrase it that way, Kanchou! I'm a glutton for uncovering the truth!

Fields.MenuText: So, where do we start?

Fields.DialogueText: I was thinking... Northern Hemisphere first. Unless, Kanchou, you are partial to the Southern Hemisphere. I'm happy to follow your orders on this choice!

Fields.MenuText: We could sail a lifetime and never find it, you know?

Fields.DialogueText: Then I would have no regrets. Not a single moment wasted.
*ALARM*
Maybe that postcard is from the Morgana home world.
Brrr! Iwanaide, Kanchou... You're giving me goosebumps!
@BATTLE
They're not letting up yet!
We'll drive them back! keep fighting!
@BATTLE
Wah! Tsukareta~
You seem to have mastered that radio now.
It feels like another limb by this point!

Fields.MenuText: How do you stay so positive amidst such chaos?
Do you ever worry about the war's outcome?

Fields.DialogueText: Guuzen dewanai, Kanchou. You have to actively try to be positive or the war will eat you alive!
Not really. Like I said before - if I search for my paradise and die before finding it, I did all I could with the time I was given.
I'll fight this war to my dying breath and go down satisfied that I could have done no more.

Fields.MenuText: What present should I get for you next time?

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, you spoil me too much! I'll let you know...
It looks to be smooth sailing from here on out. At least for a while.
Clear skies make for a perfect vantage point. I'll find my Eden by the war's end. I promise.
And I'll be beside you every step of the way.
Hai, Kanchou! Yoroshiku onegaishimasu!
